page.title: 18BREAN DOWN PART 1
page.content: BREAN DOWN IS A BIRD SANCTURY AND A SITE OF SPECIAL SCIENTIFIC INTEREST.THE FORT ON THE WESTERN END OF THE DOWN IS OWNED BY WESTEN SUPER MARE,BUT MOST OF THE DOWN WAS GIVEN TO THE NATIONAL TRUST IN 1951 BY THE AXEBRIDGE RURAL DISTRICT COUNCIL WHO STILL MANAGE IT FOR THE TRUST. THE FORT WAS BUILT IN 1867 AS PROTECTION AGAINST A POSSIBLE INVAISION BY NAPOLEON III.IT HELD A GARRISON OF FIFTY MEN AND WAS ARMED WITH SEVEN 7INCH CALIBRE CANNONS.A ROAD KNOWN AS THE MILITARY ROAD WAS ALSO BUILT COVERING MOST OF THE LENGTH OF THE DOWN.THIS ROAD IS NOW TARRED.THE FORT WAS BUILT IN CONECTION WITH SIMILAR FORTS ON STEEP HOLM.ON JULY 4th 1900 AN EXPLOSION OCCURED KILLING ONE MAN.THE FOT WAS USED IN BOTH WORLD WARS.
